abstract.p: Vodafone AirTouch is talking to Wind SpA about buying Infostrada, Italian fixed-phone company that Vodafone inherited as part of its purchase of Mannesmann of Germany; Wind's bid of 11.5 billion euros, or about $9.7 billion, exceeds 9 billion euro offer from Albacom, business phone consortium that is 23 percent owned by British Telecommunications (S)

block.p: The British mobile phone company Vodafone AirTouch is talking to Wind S.p.A. about buying Infostrada, an Italian fixed-line phone company that Vodafone inherited as part of its purchase of Mannesmann of Germany. Wind's bid of 11.5 billion euros, or about $9.7 billion, exceeded a 9 billion euro offer from Albacom, a business phone consortium that is 23 percent owned by British Telecommunications. Specializing in wireless, fixed-line and Internet operations, Wind is controlled by the Italian state-owned electricity utility Enel and by France Telecom. Should the sale not go through, Vodafone could revert to its original plan of selling a 49 percent stake of Infostrada through a share offering.

The British mobile phone company Vodafone AirTouch is talking to Wind S.p.A. about buying Infostrada, an Italian fixed-line phone company that Vodafone inherited as part of its purchase of Mannesmann of Germany. Wind's bid of 11.5 billion euros, or about $9.7 billion, exceeded a 9 billion euro offer from Albacom, a business phone consortium that is 23 percent owned by British Telecommunications. Specializing in wireless, fixed-line and Internet operations, Wind is controlled by the Italian state-owned electricity utility Enel and by France Telecom. Should the sale not go through, Vodafone could revert to its original plan of selling a 49 percent stake of Infostrada through a share offering.
